definitions: Past tense of clap; to strike the palms of (one's hands) together repeatedly, typically in order to applaud or to keep time to music.
Past tense of clap; to put or place (something) somewhere quickly and with a slapping sound.
Past tense of clap; to strike (someone) lightly with the open hand, especially in an encouraging or friendly way.
examples: He clapped a hand on my shoulder.
